poem:
### Toxic Cocktail

In the quiet dust of morning,  
pesticides mingle casually,   
a chorus of whispers  
in every corner.  
  
They dance unseen,  
a toxic ballet across Europe,  
a chemistry of harm  
hid in our daily sweep—  
we breathe in their unkindness,  
while science holds its breath  
for regulators to unmix  
this perilous potion.
